segment.source: Out Of Box Experience
segment.target: Out Of Box Experience

segment.source: Out Of Box Experience
segment.target: Out Of Box Experience

segment.source: Out Of Box Experience
segment.target: Out Of Box Experience

segment.source: Applies To: Windows 8.1, Windows 10
segment.target: Applies To: Windows 8.1, Windows 10

segment.source: This assessment measures the duration of key aspects of the first startup experience (OOBE) that are typically impacted by image customizations and software add-ons applied to the Windows retail image.
segment.target: This assessment measures the duration of key aspects of the first startup experience (OOBE) that are typically impacted by image customizations and software add-ons applied to the Windows retail image.

segment.source: The measurements are obtained from performance traces collected using Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) during a Windows 10 system’s first startup.
segment.target: The measurements are obtained from performance traces collected using Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) during a Windows 10 system’s first startup.

segment.source: The assessment measures the duration of First Logon as well as specific aspects such as Active Setup and Provisioned App Install.
segment.target: The assessment measures the duration of First Logon as well as specific aspects such as Active Setup and Provisioned App Install.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Before You Begin
segment.target: Before You Begin

segment.source: Manual execution of assessment
segment.target: Manual execution of assessment

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: Before You Begin
segment.target: Before You Begin

segment.source: Warning This assessment does not execute in an automated fashion.
segment.target: Warning This assessment does not execute in an automated fashion.

segment.source: Warning The image being tested needs to be in a never-been-booted state in order for measurements to be successfully collected.
segment.target: Warning The image being tested needs to be in a never-been-booted state in order for measurements to be successfully collected.

segment.source: Attempting to revert an assessed image back to the pre-OOBE state will not yield comparable results and is not a supported scenario.
segment.target: Attempting to revert an assessed image back to the pre-OOBE state will not yield comparable results and is not a supported scenario.

segment.source: Manual execution of assessment
segment.target: Manual execution of assessment

segment.source: This assessment requires manual execution in order to collect the data necessary to provide results.
segment.target: This assessment requires manual execution in order to collect the data necessary to provide results.

segment.source: Please follow the following instructions.
segment.target: Please follow the following instructions.

segment.source: Create a new package job with just the OOBE assessment.
segment.target: Create a new package job with just the OOBE assessment.

segment.source: In the Windows Assessment Console, select the Manufacturing and Deployment tab.
segment.target: In the Windows Assessment Console, select the Manufacturing and Deployment tab.

segment.source: If the tab is not opened, click the Home page and then double-click the job to open it.
segment.target: If the tab is not opened, click the Home page and then double-click the job to open it.

segment.source: Click Package.
segment.target: Click Package.

segment.source: In the Package a Job to Run on Another Computer dialog box, enter notes that will help you identify this job when you select results to open and view, such as Packaged Manufacturing and Deployment Job.
segment.target: In the Package a Job to Run on Another Computer dialog box, enter notes that will help you identify this job when you select results to open and view, such as Packaged Manufacturing and Deployment Job.

segment.source: In the Package path box, type the location where you want to store the job package.
segment.target: In the Package path box, type the location where you want to store the job package.

segment.source: For this exercise, the location should be on removable media such as a USB flash drive.
segment.target: For this exercise, the location should be on removable media such as a USB flash drive.

segment.source: In the Results path box, type the location where you want to store the results.
segment.target: In the Results path box, type the location where you want to store the results.

segment.source: By default, this is the relative path of a .Results folder in the same location where the job is run.
segment.target: By default, this is the relative path of a .Results folder in the same location where the job is run.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: When the job is packaged, the location where you stored the job will open.
segment.target: When the job is packaged, the location where you stored the job will open.

segment.source: Eject the USB flash drive.
segment.target: Eject the USB flash drive.

segment.source: Prepare a machine by installing the Windows image that will be assessed.
segment.target: Prepare a machine by installing the Windows image that will be assessed.

segment.source: Copy the package to this machine (ideally on a different disk and partition).
segment.target: Copy the package to this machine (ideally on a different disk and partition).

segment.source: Boot the machine.
segment.target: Boot the machine.

segment.source: When the first prompt appears, press “shift + F10” to open an admin command prompt.
segment.target: When the first prompt appears, press “shift + F10” to open an admin command prompt.

segment.source: Navigate to your ADK package.
segment.target: Navigate to your ADK package.

segment.source: Run “cd Assessment1%PROCESSORARCHITECTURE%” and then run “addautologger.reg”.
segment.target: Run “cd Assessment1%PROCESSORARCHITECTURE%” and then run “addautologger.reg”.

segment.source: Confirm the registry settings were imported successfully.
segment.target: Confirm the registry settings were imported successfully.

segment.source: Run “shutdown /r /t 0” in the command prompt.
segment.target: Run “shutdown /r /t 0” in the command prompt.

segment.source: The machine will reboot.
segment.target: The machine will reboot.

segment.source: Upon reboot, enter the required data to have the machine proceed through OOBE.
segment.target: Upon reboot, enter the required data to have the machine proceed through OOBE.

segment.source: Use a local or live account depending on the scenario you wish to test..
segment.target: Use a local or live account depending on the scenario you wish to test..

segment.source: Upon reaching the desktop, navigate to your ADK package.
segment.target: Upon reaching the desktop, navigate to your ADK package.

segment.source: Run “cd Assessment1%PROCESSORARCHITECTURE%” and run ”stopautologger.cmd”.
segment.target: Run “cd Assessment1%PROCESSORARCHITECTURE%” and run ”stopautologger.cmd”.

segment.source: This will collect the ETW trace that was started with the autologger and other relevant logs.
segment.target: This will collect the ETW trace that was started with the autologger and other relevant logs.

segment.source: The folder named “Assessment1%PROCESSORARCHITECTURE%date-timeusernamemachinename” is where results are created.
segment.target: The folder named “Assessment1%PROCESSORARCHITECTURE%date-timeusernamemachinename” is where results are created.

segment.source: Copy these contents to a machine that has the ADK installed to analyze the results.
segment.target: Copy these contents to a machine that has the ADK installed to analyze the results.

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: These settings are defined by Microsoft to ensure that the results can be compared across different computer configurations or over time on the same computer.
segment.target: These settings are defined by Microsoft to ensure that the results can be compared across different computer configurations or over time on the same computer.

segment.source: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates that the recommended settings were used so that you can easily identify results that use recommended settings in addition to those that don’t.
segment.target: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates that the recommended settings were used so that you can easily identify results that use recommended settings in addition to those that don’t.

segment.source: You can also customize these settings if you want to gather different data than what is captured by default.
segment.target: You can also customize these settings if you want to gather different data than what is captured by default.

segment.source: For example, you might identify specific data that would help you do a more detailed analysis of a particular aspect of the computer.
segment.target: For example, you might identify specific data that would help you do a more detailed analysis of a particular aspect of the computer.

segment.source: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended setting values, and alternative values for each setting.
segment.target: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended setting values, and alternative values for each setting.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Manually Collected OOBE Logs
segment.target: Manually Collected OOBE Logs

segment.source: This is the full path to the folder that contains the trace and logs from the manual execution of OOBE.
segment.target: This is the full path to the folder that contains the trace and logs from the manual execution of OOBE.

segment.source: This is a required parameter for analysis.
segment.target: This is a required parameter for analysis.
